186031413.review:
Hey there, fellow gamers! If you're into history, exploration, and epic stories, *Assassin's Creed Origins* is like a dream come true. Here's why you'll love it:

- **Explore Like Never Before:** 
The world of Egypt in this game is absolutely massive and gorgeous. From the bustling streets of Alexandria to the tranquil Nile, you'll feel like you're on a real adventure.

- **A Story You'll Care About:** 
You step into the sandals of Bayek, whose journey from personal vendetta to something far greater is both touching and thrilling. It's not just a game; it's a story you'll remember.

- **Fight Your Way:** 
The combat system is revamped - it's all about strategy now. Whether you sneak or go head-to-head, every fight feels rewarding. Plus, you can customize your skills, making your Bayek truly yours!

- **A Visual and Audio Treat:** 
The graphics are stunning, making every sunset or pyramid climb a moment to screenshot. And the music? It'll transport you straight to ancient Egypt.

Assassin's Creed Origins is more than just a game; it's an invitation to explore one of the world's greatest civilizations. It's perfect for anyone looking for a blend of history, action, and a bit of magic.

186025419.review:
Assassin's Creed® Origins для мене, як ковток свіжого повітря, після попередніх частин. Вдруге, коли в мене виникає таке відчуття. Origins — це майже ідеальна RPG. 80 зі 100 можу їй дати.

Гра захоплює. Великий мальовничий, яскравий Світ: Стародавній Єгипет, Александрія, Сфінкс і Піраміди. Купа дрібного піску та величезні пустелі. Міфологія та Боги Єгипту.
Радує, сюжет гри. Уперше за багато років, у серії ігор, він запам’ятовується. Є занурення в життя головного героя. Разом із героєм відчуваєш і радісні емоції і сум, біль та втрату.

У цій грі — є майже всі елементи сучасної RPG:
1. Повноцінна прокачка персонажу й дерево здібностей.
2. Покращення зброї. Крафт амуніції (сумок та елементів одягу).
Водночас, є поділ на класи за якістю зброї: Звичайна зброя — синього кольору. З бонусами — фіолетового кольору. Унікальна (найкраща) золотого кольору.
3. Полювання на диких звірів, як у Assassin's Creed III. Є леви, крокодили, бегемоти. Навіть проти слонів є завдання!
4. Часткове повернення морських битв та завдань. Ех... відразу ностальгія за Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag.

Водночас у грі все ще зберігається лінійний сюжет. Минуле, яке неможливо змінити. Анімус і занурення в ДНК предків.

Щодо мінусів гри
1. Починаючи з Assassin's Creed II у головного персонажа обов’язково був свій дім або база асасинів. У цій грі — ми вільно мандруємо Світом, без прив’язки до власного дому/бази.
2. Гра заточена на гринд. Навіть не намагайтеся на 30 рівні перемогти противника 32 рівня і вище. Один удар від ворога і відразу десинхронізація.
3. Ubisoft вирізали частину контенту і пропонують його купувати за Helix (віртуальна валюта в обмін на реальні гроші) у вбудованому магазині. Це елементи Free-to-play та «економії часу».
Навіть у виданні «Gold Edition» вони є.

Детально хочу зупинитися на цьому магазині:
1. Частину платного контенту можна здобувати й у самій гри за завдання.
2. До версії гри 1.61 була можливість за драхми (валюту гри) грати в лотерею, купувати Хека скрині та відчиняти.
3. Якщо почитати форуми, згадати про Nexusmods[spoiler], то є і інші способи дістати безкоштовно платний контент[/spoiler].

Загалом гра мені подобається. На рівні з Відьмак 3. Рекомендую.
Для гри використовую геймпад DualShock 4. Windows 11. Гра не вилітає. Додатково для Windows 11 24H2 — Ubisoft нещодавно випустили оновлення гри до 1.62.

186016457.review:
[b] [b] [h1] 암살도 rpg도 제대로 섞지못한.. 과도기의 어쌔신 크리드 [/h1] [/b] [/b]

[장점]
1. 신선한 시도 rpg와 암살의 융합
2. 고대 이집트를 제대로 담아낸 고증 변태 유비소프트
3. 사막의 풍경을 표현하기 위한 광기


[단점]
1. 밋밋한 주인공, 허술한 창단 계기, 늘어지는 전개 
2. 매력없는 사이드 퀘스트의 강제, 유비식 오픈월드
3. 과도기적인 전투 시스템, 다채롭지 못한 모션과 rpg 요소
4. rpg 요소의 추가로 그나마 잘 마련되던 암살 시스템도 죽어버림.
5. 위 모든 요소가 어우러져 더 끔찍해짐.



<세부내용>

독창성:★★★☆☆
그래픽:★★★★☆
사운드:★★☆☆☆
스토리:★☆☆☆☆
레벨디자인:★☆☆☆☆
조작감:★★☆☆☆


분명 이집트는 잘 담아내었습니다.. 그렇습니다... 근데 제대로 어필되지 못하는 스토리, 모션 한두개만 사용해서 전투의 재미도 없음.. 레벨 조금만 높아도 암살은 불가, 암살 하려면 사이드 퀘스트의 강제, 근데 그 사이드 퀘스트는 재미 없고 너무 많음, 그렇다고 메인스토리도 재미없으니.. 고통스럽습니다.


독창성:고대 이집트를 이만큼이나 잘 담아낸 게임은 앞으로도 없을지 모릅니다. 다만 이건 게임이지 역사용 메타버스가 아닙니다. 이집트와는 별개로 게임성에서는 너무 미흡한점이 많습니다.


그래픽: 사막의 모래의 흐름, 고대 이집트의 풍경, 기상현상과 사막의 별바다.. 그런면에서 보면 분명 환상을 보여주는 게임입니다... 그래픽적으로서는 충분히 해볼만한 게임입니다....그렇지만...


사운드: 사운드는 밋밋하거나, 별로 부각도 안되며, 오히려 극의 단조로움과 지겨움을 강조하기만 합니다. 애초에 사운드를 잘 활용한다고 생각할만한 부분도 없고요..


스토리: 최악입니다.. 아무리 전투가 재미없어도, 지금까지 유비가 쌓아온 암살단과 템플러의 싸움의 계기라는 것에서 충분히 세일즈 포인트를 가져갈 수 있었을테지만, 묵묵하다못해 매력적이지 못한 주인공, 비장한 주인공의 목적의식에 비해 너무 동떨어진듯한 사이드 퀘스트로 정신을 더 흐트러지며, 감정 변화 없는 주인공이 한명씩 암살해가며 점점 스토리가 늘어지는꼴을 보자면 처참하다 못해 속이 뒤집어 집니다... 심지어 그 '오리진'이라는것도 참... 하아........


레벨디자인: 끔찍합니다. 2~3레벨만 넘어가도 암살이 안되다보니, 강제로 사이드퀘스트를 밀어야 하며, 그 사이드 퀘스트도 거의 비슷한 구조를 가지고 있어, 쉽게 지겨워지며, 레벨업에 따른 보상은 데미지와 스킬트리, 그리고 장비제한이 풀리는정도인데, 스킬은 매력이 없으며, 장비는 무기당 모션이 다채롭지 못해, 전투도 재미없고, 암살은 느려터졌으며 모션도 동일하니.. 심지어 보스들 패턴도 거의 비슷비슷하며, 불릿 스폰지 급으로 체력이 많아서.. 진짜로.. 진짜로 노잼이었습니다.


조작감: 마상전투 조작감은 뭣같으며. 그외 조작감은 괜찮으나, 앞서 말했듯 모션도 별로 없고 느려터지고 불릿스폰지 스러운 전투는 괜찮은 조작감도 토나올정도로 지루하게 만듭니다.



이다음에 나올 어크 오디세이는 명작이라는 말이 많습니다만, 오리진은 암살도 RPG도 실패한 어중간한 작품에
스토리 또한 늘어지고, 매력도 없으며, 주인공도 밋밋한 진짜 어디에서나 두걸음씩은 부족한 어쌔신 크리드였습니다.

그냥 유튜브에서 스토리 요약영상만 보시고 바로 오디세이로 넘어가시는걸 추천드립니다.
느려터진 레벨링 속도와, 반복되는 구성을 견뎌가면서 볼만한 스토리가 아닙니다.

186005926.review:
Benim gözümde serinin yeniden doğduğu oyun… Ubisoft’tan uzun zamandır görmeye alışık olmadığımız kalitedeki bir şaheser…

Sanırım öncelikle oynanış kısmını ele almak lazım çünkü Origins seriye bambaşka bir soluk getirmiş. Eski oyunlardaki klasik "gizlice yaklaşıp öldür" mekaniklerinin yerini, çok daha RPG odaklı bir sistem almış. Seviyeniz, ekipmanlarınız ve yetenek ağacınız artık oynanışta büyük bir fark yaratıyor. Dövüş sistemi tamamen elden geçirilmiş ve bu sayede yakın dövüşler bence çok tatmin edici olmuş. Okçuluk da oldukça keyifli. Özellikle farklı yay türleriyle oyuna güzel bir derinlik katmışlar. Bu oyunla anladım ki eski oyunlar da iyi güzeldi ama oynanış sistemi dedin mi böyle olacak!

Geldik açık dünyaya. Oyunun açık dünyası inanılmaz detaylı. Giza piramitlerinden, Alexandria’ya, Nil Nehri’nin kıyılarından, çöl kasabalarına ve uçsuz bucaksız çöllere kadar her yer öyle güzel tasarlanmış ki, görev yapmadan gezerek bile saatleriniz akıp gidebilir oyun başında. Daha önce Mısır'a en ufak bir ilgim bile yokken, oyunu oynarken defalarca "Keşke gezip görebilsem buraları" dedirtti bana. Görsel güzelliğinin yanı sıra oyunun açık dünyasında keşfedilecek tonla şey var. Oyunda yaşayan bir dünya hissi de muazzam bir şekilde verilmiş.

Bayek toplulukta, diğer ana karakterler kadar ilgi görmüyor gördüğüm kadarıyla. Ki bu anlam veremediğim bir şey çünkü hem karakterin kendisi hem de hikayesi gerçekten ilgi çekici. Bayek’in hem karanlık hem de insancıl yönleri ustaca işlenmiş. Bayek dışında bu oyunda "AYA" diye bir gerçek de var... (Oyun dünyasındaki favori kadın karakterlerimden biri olmaya çok büyük bir aday kendisi.) Ayrıca, hikaye Antik Mısır’da geçen Brotherhood’un nasıl oluştuğunu gösteriyor ve bazı yerlerde önceki oyunlardan bildiğimiz karakter (bkz, Desmond Miles) ve olaylara da selam gönderiyor. Bu yönüyle de seriyi uzun süredir takip edenler için ayrı güzellikler taşıyor.

Oyunun hiç mi eksisi yok? Var tabii ki. Çok kaliteli yan görevler olduğu gibi, bir o kadar gereksiz ve boş yan görev de mevcut. 100 tane yan görev koyacağına 50 tane koy, güzellerini koy amk illa bokunu çıkartacan Ubisoft. Birde o kadar tasarımı ve görselliği övdüm ama güzel tasarıma rağmen, haritanın bazı yerleri özellikle çöller bomboş. Çöl temasını iyi yansıtmışlar ama gerçekten gereğinden fazla geniş tutmuşlar. Keşfetme isteğim sağ olsun, "Belki bir şey vardır" diye çölde dakikalarca at sürdüm, deve sürdüm ama... BOMBOŞ. Yinede oyun bütün olarak o kadar güzel ki bu saydığım eksiler gözünüze çok batmayacak emin olun.

Sonuç olarak, Assassin's Creed serisini veya RPG oyunlarını seviyorsanız pişman etmez.

185980062.review: Assassin’s Creed: Истоки не просто продолжает тему ассасинов — она сама та ещё «убийца»! Только не тамплиеров, а вашего времени. Удаётся ей это дело настолько ловко, что поначалу беды даже не замечаешь. Занятий здесь море: посещения величественных пирамид, прогулка по раскалённым пустынным пескам, исследования мрачных гробниц, штурма римских крепостей и, конечно же, множества охот. Кроме того, нашлось в «Истоках» место и для морских битв, а также для гонок на колесницах. Однако есть один момент, который портит всё впечатление от игры. В какой-то момент вы устаёте от открытого мира и хотите продолжить основной сюжет, но не можете. Потому что для этого ваш персонаж должен быть достаточно сильным, а его уровень оказывается недостаточным. И этот «потолок» уровней — пожалуй, самое противоречивое решение в игре.

185947970.review: 刺客信条系长史中《刺客信条》，一种大胆新家。自丁亥年始明相，刺客信条系已成开世戏之心，而《源》不特以末法之深，玩兼入广而充史气之古，见刺客所起，此其大史之转折也。戏事之情节、视效、战系统等多之罢，使其作既系新之作，亦刺客丽史诗也。《刺客信条》：起于前四十九年，古者，托密王于内外忧恶。戏主者，伏驮克，一法老宿卫，其宗以谋受创，巴伏报可将揭刺客之源，易天下之制。又《刺客信条》系言，往者数年渐就公式化之法已疲。是故，造团队于《起》之中，益其机心。最为著之变一为战系统之穷。《本》于去故突式战一概，转易其义，振其动静以应之。然后知制诰既同游戏，又留刺客系素之命。又《源》于膀胱关元素所广亦足论也。戏中雅惠在最深入，伏驮克可由成务、破贼、求世诸义之数，进技解新之力。无论近战远射。百工之事，一家可据一好战之度。《刺客信条：源源》为玩室所未有古和开世，洪无野幕、波光空水之尼河、繁闹之城及误落金塔群精还出。得失考之，犹视之于明，古之遗风。其制团队用前之术，塑其影于地形；虽鼓静无动，望远方金寻塔沙漠，咸令人心感震——此古神姿及也。求之起于此，则投一番吐。非主线事外，世间多支业、挑战、野生物、宝藏以待之。纵然无明的，玩家亦沉浸于求者，随伏驮开古心火水通。每攻城、一国之址，皆有偏负景、文蔚之家，非独冒险也，又若一场之旅焉。戏故事皆跌荡尽靡以为戏。江湖之间，玩弄家难斗争之政，并揭刺客兄弟之真貌焉。先是，刺客结非一始明其道，成其谋与叛，伏弢与其妻阿伊莎者，君子之机也。伏苓克充复仇之火，而其说亦令深感遗佚重。於戏中，玩家特须作巴毒以报，更须敌与战艰难，权情与理相敌。无论寄密季贵人斗争不已，与希腊化之英及英博，每一策皆尤要。阿伊莎此一佳像尤甚。非徒巴伏驮之伍，亦其最优之支神也。两人夹戏中展极为颊皓齿，尤坠政波也，恃相扶，丰有益于味。《刺客信条：生卷舒、玩法新深剧，沉戏力也。从大者古制及世，至甚相表里，乃引胜之情，游戏者非止为刺客信条注新命，亦使玩家之娱以致此隙也。是则仇、背与牲之法；此文之操事也。又刺客信条简文无畏之变调也。不特胜往诊，尤是盛时。于念念之间，必有缓书：起将一场难忘，一时无可复用奇。

185944638.review: 《刺客信条：起源》是一款值得推荐的游戏。它将玩家带入古埃及，堪称“埃及旅游模拟器”，地理风光与历史遗迹还原度极高，从狮身人面像到胡夫金字塔，尽显古埃及风情，且不同地区风土民情各异。游戏从ACT转向RPG，装备系统变为刷刷刷模式，有等级划分，数值化明显，可通过多种方式升级物品。战斗系统大幅革新，有魂系列影子，操作更难但熟练后仍能找回割草感，还新增相片模式，让玩家能记录精彩瞬间，是一款兼具探索、战斗与美景的佳作。

185892548.review:
I enjoyed some parts of this game and others not so much. I think this game is technically a good game and is polished at a good level. The mechanics of this game are ok. the lvl system is poorly designed and you are basically forced to be at the same lvl as the enemies or you get one shot quick.

Now as an old school AC fan i am torn. In many ways this game is a big step back and in others its a step forward. I don't like how stealth "kills" do not always kill someone. I don't like how you can't fight with the hidden blade. The open world is just ok. It is mostly bloat and I did not enjoy the side quest so i stuck to the main story. The parkour was better with the ability to climb more objects but it was not as smooth as the other games. The rpg elements of this newer series is pretty shallow. Overall I give this game a solid 7/10 and would recommend it for others if it's on sale

185873525.review:
Assassin's Creed Origins เป็นเกมแนวแอ็กชัน RPG ที่พาผู้เล่นย้อนเวลากลับไปยังอียิปต์โบราณ เพื่อสัมผัสต้นกำเนิดของภราดรภาพนักฆ่า ผ่านเรื่องราวของ Bayek ผู้เป็น Medjay ที่ต้องแก้แค้นและปกป้องผู้คนจากอำนาจเผด็จการ

จุดเด่น
กราฟิกและโลกเปิด: อียิปต์ในเกมถูกออกแบบมาอย่างสวยงามและสมจริง มีสถานที่สำคัญ เช่น ปิรามิดแห่งกิซ่า และแม่น้ำไนล์
ระบบการต่อสู้ใหม่: เปลี่ยนมาใช้ระบบที่เน้นการล็อกเป้าหมายและการใช้ทักษะ ทำให้สนุกและท้าทายยิ่งขึ้น
การพัฒนาแบบ RPG: ผู้เล่นสามารถอัปเกรดอาวุธ ทักษะ และปรับแต่งการเล่นให้เข้ากับสไตล์ตัวเอง
เควสต์ที่หลากหลาย: เนื้อเรื่องหลักเข้มข้น และเควสต์รองช่วยเพิ่มมิติให้กับตัวละครและโลกในเกม
ข้อสังเกต
เควสต์รองบางอันอาจรู้สึกซ้ำซาก
AI ของศัตรูบางครั้งดูง่ายเกินไป
เหมาะสำหรับ: คนที่ชอบเกมโลกเปิดสำรวจได้เต็มที่ และสนใจประวัติศาสตร์อียิปต์

คะแนน: 8.5/10 เป็นเกมที่มีความลึกและเต็มไปด้วยความสนุกในการสำรวจ แต่ยังมีจุดเล็ก ๆ ที่ปรับปรุงได้

185869603.review:
Jogo sensacional, o mundo é lindo, você pode explorar as cidades do Egito antigo, Alexandria, as piramides e os desertos... me encantei com a cultura egípcia, e a história principal é muito boa também, fiquei imerso na trama de Bayek e Aya, e ver a origem do credo dos assassinos, poder interagir com figuras históricas lendárias como a Cleópatra e Cesar (e presenciar a a cena da clássica pra frase "Et tu, Brute?"). Nesse momento fechei a história principal, mas ainda não explorei todo o mapa, pretendo fazer isso e também fazer algumas missões secundarias.

Os pontos negativos que eu achei foram algumas mecânicas de combate ruins principalmente quando se enfrenta mais de dois inimigos, o sistema de progressão que te atrapalha em avançar na história do jogo e as missões secundarias, que sinceramente não tive saco pra fazer, quanto aos bugs, tive alguns mas não ao ponto de atrapalhar  minha jogantina.

Jgouei quase todos os ACs e posso dizer que esse é um dos melhores, uma joia.

185858670.review:
Assassin’s Creed Origins marks a bold step forward for the iconic series, blending a rich narrative, stunning visuals, and a reinvented gameplay style. Set in ancient Egypt during the Ptolemaic era, the game offers an expansive open-world experience that feels alive and authentic.

Story & Setting
The story follows Bayek, a Medjay seeking justice, as he uncovers the origins of the Assassin Brotherhood. The richly detailed setting of Egypt—complete with bustling cities, sprawling deserts, and the majestic Nile—immerses players in a world that feels historically vibrant and culturally rich.

Gameplay
Origins departs from traditional Assassin’s Creed mechanics, introducing RPG elements like leveling, gear customization, and skill trees. The revamped combat system is more dynamic and engaging, offering a variety of weapons and strategies to tackle enemies. Quests are diverse and often layered, encouraging exploration and rewarding curiosity.

Graphics & Sound
Visually, the game is breathtaking, with meticulous attention to detail in both landscapes and architecture. The dynamic lighting and day-night cycle enhance the immersive experience. The soundtrack, composed by Sarah Schachner, perfectly complements the tone, blending mystery and grandeur.

Pros

Vast and visually stunning open world.
Deep, engaging story with memorable characters.
Revamped gameplay with RPG elements and improved combat.
Excellent side quests and world-building.
Cons

Occasional bugs and glitches.
Some repetitive objectives in side missions.
Verdict
Assassin’s Creed Origins is a refreshing reinvention of the series, offering both longtime fans and newcomers an exciting adventure. With its rich narrative, captivating setting, and refined gameplay mechanics, it’s a must-play for those seeking an immersive open-world experience.

Rating: 9/10

185857695.review:
Highly recommend this game.

I am using Windows 11 version 23H2 so I did not experience any problems like other players who are using 24H2.

This game is very good especially in terms of control, both are comfortable between using a keyboard or controller, but I am more comfortable using a controller because this game has settings to customize the action buttons on the controller, which is a feature that is very rare in other games. You can adjust the buttons on the controller according to your playing comfort.

This game is also good because it has a photomode feature in it, this is very meaningful for players who often capture moments using the photomode in the game.

In terms of story, this game also has an easy-to-understand story using common English or not pure English so that the story is easier to translate.

In terms of graphics. This game has pretty good graphics for a 2017 game, with minimum specifications that are friendly to players who only have low-end computers even at low graphics settings, the graphics of this game can still be enjoyed without making the eyes uncomfortable.

185791335.review:
After passing the game and doing most of the secondary quests, I can say with total certainty that I would not recommend it to anyone, and the game demonstrates the lacks and reasons why Ubisoft is currently in this deteriorated state as a company.

The protagonist is empty, literally has no personality whatsoever, it doesn't help that the game doesn't care about the present timeline at all, you could skip the whole present timeline and it won't change exactly nothing and without going into spoilers it has an anticlimactic ending as if the game was half done.

About the story It's pretty predictable in general in the sense that I didn't get any surprises.
and although they give a satisfactory closure to the protagonist, it is depressing to consider that in the final stretch of the game is where it happens, the most important thing he loses prominence to give it to his wife, a character that, without going into spoilers, has few mentions in previous sagas and that will not have any relevant appearance again.

The side quests are interesting in general; you can tell they put more effort into them, sometimes even more than the main story, but the side quests, no matter how good they are, can't save an 80-hour game.
By the middle of the game I was already burnt out with so many side quests because, even though, as I said, they are very good and have more background than what you would expect from Ubisoft side quests, they still don't have much relevance to the story and end up feeling like a chore and a pain in the ass in the long run.

At the end of the day, this game is decent, to be kind, but it's the kind of game I would recommend if you literally have nothing else to play. something to pass the time and little else.

趁着冬季特惠买的，花了120小时刷完了本体+DLC全部内容
总体而言相当不错，整体难度不高，风景建模优秀，到熟练操作后完全后可以当成埃及旅游模拟器来玩！
UBI把埃及末期的历史、及古埃及传说都融入到起源中了，剧情虽然简单，但是极具史诗感，八爷和艾雅完成小家到大家的升华，从执意复仇到最后决定分开遁入五形，完成使命的感觉太棒了！最后纵深一跃真心令人感动！
不足：后期极高的探图重复度，开放却又不又完全开放的罐头模式实在有点无聊= =
PS：期待下一步影能有些新内容和玩法！

185736971.review:
[h1]Recenzja: Assassin's Creed Origins[/h1]
Assassin's Creed Origins to kolejna odsłona bestsellerowego cyklu gier akcji z otwartym światem. Tym razem przenosimy się do starożytnego Egiptu, gdzie poznajemy początki bractwa Asasynów.

[h2]• Fabuła[/h2]
Akcja gry toczy się w czasach, gdy starożytny Egipt znajdował się pod silnym wpływem dynastii Ptolemeuszy. Gracze wcielają się w Bayeka z Siwy – nubijskiego wojownika, który służył faraonom jako agent i elitarny strażnik prawa. Jednak zmieniające się realia, napędzane greckimi wpływami, zmuszają bohatera do adaptacji i przyjęcia nowych wyzwań. W tle epickiej historii poznajemy intrygę prowadzącą do powstania bractwa Asasynów.

Jak w większości gier z serii, także tutaj pojawiają się epizody osadzone w czasach współczesnych. W tych fragmentach gracze odkrywają kolejne sekrety korporacji Abstergo Industries, ukrywającej działalność zakonu Templariuszy – odwiecznych wrogów Asasynów.

[h2]• Plusy[/h2]
- Grafika – Pięknie odwzorowany starożytny Egipt, pełen szczegółów i majestatycznych krajobrazów.
- Nowa mechanika gry – Twórcy odświeżyli system walki, wprowadzając więcej taktyki.
- Soundtrack – Klimatyczna muzyka doskonale oddaje atmosferę epoki.
- Postacie historyczne – Kleopatra i Juliusz Cezar nadają fabule autentyczności.
- Rozbudowane drzewko umiejętności – Daje graczom swobodę w rozwijaniu postaci.
- Duża różnorodność broni – Każda z unikalnym stylem walki.
- Brutalne finishery – Dodają realizmu i dynamiki.
- Obszerna mapa – Dorównująca wielkością tej z Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag.
- Misje fabularne i poboczne – Ilość zadań zapewnia godziny rozgrywki.
- Wprowadzenie elementów RPG – Śmiałe posunięcie, które okazało się sukcesem.
- Detale życia NPC – Postacie reagują na porę dnia, wykonując różne czynności (np. jedzenie, spanie, praca).
- Crafting i ekwipunek – Rozwijanie wyposażenia daje satysfakcję.
- Realistyczne lokacje – Grobowce, piramidy, Sfinks – wszystko zachwyca.
- Długa rozgrywka – Przejście gry wraz z dodatkami zajmuje około 50-60 godzin, choć bardziej skupieni gracze mogą ukończyć ją w ok. 45 godzin. Nadal jednak pozostaje sporo misji pobocznych i miejsc do odkrycia, co wydłuża czas zabawy.
- Tryb aparatu (F3) – Idealny do uwieczniania malowniczych widoków.
• Dodatki: Polecam z całego serca!
Gra Assassin's Creed Origins w pełni rozwija swój potencjał dzięki dwóm dodatkom: The Hidden Ones i The Curse of the Pharaohs. Oto dlaczego warto sięgnąć po edycję zawierającą oba rozszerzenia:

[h2]The Hidden Ones[/h2]: Dodatek ten kontynuuje historię Bayeka i rozwija wątek bractwa Asasynów. Akcja toczy się kilka lat po wydarzeniach z głównej gry i przenosi nas na nową mapę – Półwysep Synaj. Kampania jest bardziej kameralna, ale pełna intensywnych misji, które dają wgląd w pierwsze kroki bractwa. Wprowadza też nowe wyzwania i sprzęt.

[h2]The Curse of the Pharaohs:[/h2] To dodatek, który wyróżnia się wyjątkową atmosferą. Wprowadza elementy nadprzyrodzone i przenosi nas do Doliny Królów, gdzie mierzymy się z mitycznymi potworami i klątwami faraonów. Lokacje są pięknie zaprojektowane, a nowe mechaniki, takie jak walka z duchami faraonów czy eksploracja zaświatów, nadają rozgrywce świeżości.

Każdy z dodatków wzbogaca fabułę i zapewnia dodatkowe godziny gry, oferując nowe wyzwania, zadania i przedmioty. Jeśli zamierzasz kupić Assassin's Creed Origins, serdecznie polecam edycję zawierającą oba rozszerzenia – to idealny sposób, by w pełni wykorzystać potencjał gry.

[h2]• Minusy[/h2]
- Mało różnorodne kombinacje ataków – Mimo unikalności broni, zwykłe ciosy bywają monotonne.
- Pojawiające się bugi – Chociaż niezbyt częste, mogą irytować.
- Powtarzalność misji pobocznych – Po pewnym czasie stają się schematyczne.
- Mikrotransakcje – Opcjonalne, ale mogą zakłócić balans gry.
- Sterowana strzała – Łuk drapieżcy, a zwłaszcza sterowana strzała, jest po prostu zbyt mocny. Daje to znaczną przewagę, co może obniżyć poziom trudności i zaburzyć balans rozgrywki.
- Inteligencja przeciwników – Wciąż pozostaje ich piętą achillesową.
[h2]• Podsumowanie[/h2]
Assassin's Creed Origins to świetna gra, która wprowadza wiele odświeżających zmian do znanej formuły serii. Dla fanów starożytności i długich, angażujących opowieści to pozycja obowiązkowa. Z dodatkami The Hidden Ones i The Curse of the Pharaohs doświadczenie staje się jeszcze bardziej kompletne, oferując nowe wyzwania, emocje i unikalne lokacje.

[b]Osoby, które nie miały styczności z wcześniejszymi częściami, powinny jednak rozważyć ich przejście, aby w pełni zrozumieć wątki fabularne związane z Animusem i zakonem Asasynów. Dla bardziej leniwych wystarczy obejrzeć skróconą historię serii na YouTube – na przykład odcinek o głównej historii Asasynów na kanale 'Adam Raziel'.[/b]

 [b]Ocena: 8,5/10[/b]

[i]Polecam,[/i]
[i]Motar[/i]

185735771.review:
Um jogo de boa temática, boa gameplay, personagens interessantes e mesmo tendo alguns problemas com a historia o protagonista é um personagem muito bom, esses aspectos possitivos do jogo fazem dele um titulo surpreendente, ele muda a gameplay padrão da serie mas para a minha surpresa fez isso de maneira boa, esse é um jogo do qual me diverti bastante e até hoje consegue ser bem bonito, o triste é que esse para mim é o ultimo titulo dos AC's que vale a pena comprar, todos os jogos que vieram em sequencia são muito, MUITO problemáticos em absolutamente todos os aspectos.

PS: a historia que se passa fora do animus é totalmente desinteressante e desnecessária, depois do AC 3 deviam ter focado só nas historias do passado e esquecer de tentar trazer algo no presente.

185728285.review: 2020年初我第一次在ps4玩了起源这是我人生中第一款3A游戏，对于当时刚接触这种大制作游戏的我留下了深深影响，出色的风景和丰富的战斗体验，还有主角巴耶克从为子报仇到创立无形者保护埃及人民的剧情也让我印象深刻，也是通过它我走入了刺客信条的世界观，之后我又玩了大革命，枭雄，黑旗，3代，艾吉奥三部曲和剩下的神话作品，读了一系列相关小说成了一名所谓的“老”刺客。在玩完英灵殿的时候我对那种四处结盟跑东跑西的主线任务感到厌烦甚至恶心，我理解育碧可能是要还原维京人入侵英格兰（8世纪末至9世纪初）并且丰富刺客信条的世界观。之后的幻景（平庸）和要发售的影让我感觉到刺客信条已经不如以前了。如今又重新在PC上玩完了起源和DLC又重新体验了一场埃及之旅后它无愧于我心中的第一名，是一款优秀的游戏

185726723.review:
Основной сюжет довольно простой, начинается с простой предпосылки и заканчивается тем, что вы помогаете Клеопатре в войне за трон. Побочки мне показались скучными, большинство к сожалению это просто "Иди на аванпост и спаси этого", но пару интересных все же есть. Боевка вышла круто, можно свободно двигаться и бить противника куда хочешь, в отличии от прошлых частей где все было заскриптовано под анимации убийства, из оружек только пару играбельных (Меч, хопеш, топор, ну и луки). По стелсить можно, но буд-то все сделано для открытого боя.
Паркур менее плавный и со своими багами.
Мир атмосферный, Древний Египет изображён очень красиво, но с наполнением беда.

На разок.

185704444.developer_response:
Hi Camy! Please make sure that you have installed Assassin's Creed Origins on your SSD as a starting point. That one step usually make a huge difference for most players, and hopefully we'll see a drastic improvement. 

If, for some reason, you continue to have any difficulties with Assassin's Creed Origins, these troubleshooting steps can also be rule out to cover all of our bases: 

- [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/0C48-FCBD-DA71-93EB]Verify the game files[/url]
- [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/disabling-background-applications-on-pc/000063761]Clean boot[/url] will rule out any background processes that could be conflicting (Overwolf, Steel Series, Corsair, iCue3, Razer, Synapse, etc.)
- Unplug non-essential peripherals (steering wheels and pedals, streaming equipment, additional monitors, VR equipment, etc.)
- Clear the [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/6ad7-820d-8be5-e51f]Steam cache[/url] and [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/emptying-the-cache-of-ubisoft-connect-pc/000061966]Ubisoft Connect cache[/url]
- [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/troubleshooting-technical-issues-on-pc/000061047]All steps listed in the FAQ article[/url]
- [url=https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/use-the-system-file-checker-tool-to-repair-missing-or-corrupted-system-files-79aa86cb-ca52-166a-92a3-966e85d4094e]Perform a SFC Scan[/url] (if errors are detected, repeat the scan until all results are clear)
- [url=https://docs.microsoft.com/en-US/cpp/windows/latest-supported-vc-redist?view=msvc-170]Clean reinstall the C++ supporting software[/url]

After you've gotten through the listed steps, if these technical issues STILL happen, please [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/contact]create a new support case[/url]on the Ubi website. Attaching your [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/generating-system-reports-to-help-troubleshooting/000061449]Msinfo and Dxdiag files[/url]to your support case in advance and listing the steps/workarounds we've already tried will save a considerable amount of time. Once a member of our support team has received your case, they will review everything and then follow up with you directly to proceed further.

185686116.review:
I really dont want to call this an Assassins Creed game. To me, an assassins creed game is all about sneaking around and silently stabbing people, doing some missions, and just generally being a badass in combat being able to counter anything thrown at you.

This game is none of that. Instead, we have RPG mechanics that turn the once open world of Assassins Creed games into an open world on a monorail. You have to grind to level up in order to stand a chance against "higher level opponents" effectively gatekeeping most of the game behind a grind fest, and thats before you consider that you also need to upgrade your gear through... you guessed it... a pointless hunting and grinding mechanic.

I gave this game an honest try and frankly I felt like everything I was doing was a chore. Travelling to missions, completing missions, killing enemies, all chores. I didn't feel like I was playing a game.

185670558.review:
Assassin's Creed…

Quelle licence riche, dépaysante, tourmentée et enivrante.
Elle est chargée d'histoire, de souhaits, d'espoir, de déception, de renouveau. En bref, elle est désormais le trouble reflet de ses propres enfants : des jeux uniques qui, une fois rassemblés, forment une étrange mosaïque de sentiments, de souvenirs, de nostalgie partagée par tous ses joueurs. Elle a traversé les âges, touché chaque joueur d'une manière ou d'une autre. Quoi qu'on en pense ou qu'on en dise, je pense ne pas me tromper lorsque j'affirme que cette licence a marqué l'histoire avec un petit h. Mais qui sait, bientôt nous ne rougirons pas de dire l'Histoire avec un grand H ! C'est ce qu'elle a toujours voulu au plus profond d'elle : parler d'histoires en racontant l'Histoire.
Imagée certes, affabulée assurément, mais avec poésie incontestablement.

Alors maintenant, après tant d'années de bons et loyaux services, je me dois de rendre hommage à ce qui est, pour moi, le dernier des Assassin's Creed.

Je vous passe les détails superflus, des précédents opus comme des suivants : lequel est le meilleur, le plus beau, le plus jouissif, le plus fidèle à la vision de ce qu'est Assassin's Creed.
Mais en fin de compte, qu'est-ce qu'Assassin's Creed ? Une mosaïque : un tableau brisé en myriade de petits morceaux, tous renfermant quelque chose de ce qui sera, de ce qu'est et de ce qu'était cette licence. Mais pour bien comprendre Assassin's Creed Origins, il faut bien comprendre la licence.

C'est une licence de longue date, tirée en plusieurs opus tous plus originaux que les autres. Les uns apportant leur lot de contexte et d'immersion, les autres innovant et raffinant les bases déjà établies. 
Assassin's Creed Origins se positionne dans une situation compliquée (un rappel à ce qu'Assassin's Creed Unity avait déjà vécu à l'époque) : au bord d'un ravin abyssal. Et l'ordre est d'avancer malgré tout.
Les joueurs sont lassés et la licence radote. Le monde veut du neuf et des dizaines de milliers de joueurs attendent au tournant cette vieille dame au capuchon sombre et à la manche acérée. Que va-t-elle nous concocter cette fois-ci ?
Une énième toile de vengeance rocambolesque, sautillant de toiture en toiture, filant et occisant discrètement des individus sans âme sur fond historique, répétant encore et encore les mêmes mécaniques étirées sur des siècles dans un monde toujours plus avide de neuf, de renouveau et de consommables à usage unique ?

Et dans un dernier et gracieux élan long de deux ans, la nizârite voûtée nous livre sa dernière grande toile, la plus convoitée de toute depuis très longtemps : l'Egypte.

Une gigantesque toile ensablée, controversée, incomprise de beaucoup, adulée de certains, respectée par trop peu.
Un tableau audacieux, remaniant drastiquement son style au risque d'empourprer certains de ses fans de colère ou de les verdir de dégoût, rameutant tout autant de nouveaux venus, appâtés par ce canevas intriguant dont tout le monde parle.
Une peinture qui redorera le liserai du long manteau de cette grand-mère branlante mais scellera à jamais son cercueil de verre que rien ni personne ne pourra jamais plus réveiller.

Assassin's Creed Origins est un jeu magnifique. Gigantesque de contenu et lourd de passé. C'est à mes yeux, un Skyrim de son temps : une aventure déroutante et dépaysante. En jouant, on oublie l'instant. On se laisse transcender par les parfums des quartiers, écraser par ses bâtiments de titan, perdre dans ses jungles luxuriantes et rêver dans ses dunes de sable mystérieuses.

Laissant la poésie de côté, j'estime que c'est un jeu que l'on vit. Et pour l'avoir "vécu" sur plusieurs années, je suis, pourrions nous dire, déçu que cette aventure soit terminée.
Même en ayant cette sale manie de vouloir faire traîner mes jeux (en particulier lorsque j'arrive vers la fin) le plus longtemps possible pour faire durer le plaisir, j'estime cette expérience presque trop courte. Mais les choses ne sont-elles pas plus belles lorsqu'elles sont finies dans le temps ? La vie n'a de sens que s'il y a une fin, et c'est le cas de toute chose ici-bas.

Alors oui, je philosophe dans l'herbe, je divague et je m'envole nageant entre mes souvenirs de cette série qui m'a tant marqué. Cette critique n'est pas véritablement une critique comme vous l'aurez compris : c'est un hommage, une ode, une épitaphe à ce que fut cette série.

Car, que nous le voulions ou non, son dernier coup de pinceau l'a emportée : un jet de sang de carotide tranchée en est sa signature. La lame dans la foule s'est rengainée et l'ombre servant la lumière s'est estompée. Le reste n'est que vil reflet et contrefaçon mimant les traits et l'allure de cette dame qui a porté, comme jamais une licence n'a porté, mes joies et mes peines de joueur.

Alors dans un grand essor, je tire ma révérence à tous ces personnages et fresques dantesques conçus par tant de petites mains "françaises" bourrées de talent et animées de passion !

Merci pour ces heures, ces mois, ces années passées aux côtés de nos ancêtres fantasmés. Merci d'avoir rendu mes rêves d'explorateur frustré de l'immensité du monde un tant soit peu tangibles.

Assassin's Creed, un credo pour certains, une banalité pour d'autres, une fresque d'une innombrable génération de joueurs. Un trésor enfoui et perdu à jamais.

Mais qui sait, un jour peut-être nos descendants dépoussièreront leurs étagères, décolleront un flambeau du mur et ouvriront l'entrée secrète de ce tombeau hashashin obscur. Il ne nous reste plus qu'à leur souhaiter d'avoir l'audace de plonger à leur tour dans cette sombre nuit embrassant cet héritage vieux de 17 ans et d'enfiler la capuche en se fondant dans l'ombre de l'Histoire, murmurant doucement :

"Rien n'est vrai, tout est permis."

185662190.review:
Assassin’s Creed Origins is more than a fresh start for Ubisoft’s iconic series, it’s a reinvention that blends the franchise’s hallmark elements with RPG mechanics and a sprawling open world. Set in ancient Egypt during the Ptolemaic era, it immerses players in a vibrant, living world while telling the compelling origin story of the Assassin Brotherhood.

You step into the role of Bayek of Siwa, a Medjay driven by loss and a quest for justice. Bayek is a deeply human protagonist, and his journey of vengeance and redemption is powerfully told. His relationship with his wife, Aya, adds emotional depth to the story, grounding the grand historical events in personal stakes.

The world of Origins is nothing short of stunning. From the towering pyramids and bustling cities to the serene Nile River and endless deserts, ancient Egypt is brought to life with breathtaking detail. Each location feels distinct, filled with secrets, wildlife, and stories waiting to be uncovered. The attention to historical accuracy and cultural nuance is remarkable, making exploration as educational as it is enjoyable.

Gameplay in Origins marks a significant departure from its predecessors. The combat system has been overhauled, offering a more dynamic, skill-based approach. Timing, positioning, and weapon choice play crucial roles, making battles feel challenging yet rewarding. The introduction of RPG elements, such as skill trees, gear upgrades, and level-based progression, adds depth, encouraging players to customize Bayek to suit their playstyle.

Exploration is a highlight. Climbing monuments, uncovering hidden tombs, and solving environmental puzzles are seamlessly integrated into the open-world design. The Discovery Tour mode, which allows players to explore Egypt without combat, showcases the developers’ commitment to using the game as a tool for historical storytelling.

The side quests deserve special mention. Far from being mere fetch missions, many are rich in narrative and character development, deepening your connection to the world and its inhabitants. These stories often touch on themes of oppression, family, and the clash between tradition and change, adding layers to the overarching narrative.

Visually, Origins is a masterpiece. The lighting, textures, and animations bring ancient Egypt to life in stunning detail. From the golden hues of a desert sunset to the intricate designs of temples, the game is a constant feast for the eyes. The soundtrack complements the setting beautifully, blending traditional Middle Eastern instruments with atmospheric compositions.

If there’s a criticism to be made, it’s that the game’s pacing can occasionally feel uneven, with some moments of grind between major story beats. Additionally, while the revamped combat system is engaging, it may take time for longtime fans of the series to adjust.

Ultimately, Assassin’s Creed Origins is a triumph, a bold reinvention that respects the series’ roots while carving out a fresh path. It’s a journey through history that’s as emotional as it is epic, offering a world so rich and immersive that it’s easy to lose yourself in its sands.

Whether you’re an Assassin’s Creed veteran or a newcomer, Origins is a must-play. It’s not just a game; it’s a voyage into the heart of one of history’s most fascinating eras.

185654552.review:
Para Amantes da Franquia Magnifica Assassin's Creed Origins pode comprar sem medo !!!


Até mesmo o fã mais assíduo reconhece que Assassin's Creed precisava respirar novos ares, talvez se reinventar. Foi justamente depois de Syndicate, situado na Revolução Industrial e lançado em 2015, que a Ubisoft resolveu colocar os assassinos na geladeira para ganhar tempo e retornar em grande estilo. Assassin's Creed Origins vai direto ao ponto: é o retorno triunfal que todos nós esperávamos.


Origins é, de fato, um novo começo, pois conduz o jogador às origens da Irmandade dos Assassinos, no Egito Antigo, entre pirâmides e tumbas escondidas no deserto. O protagonista é Bayek de Siuá, um protetor de faraó e defensor do povo egípcio que se torna um matador ao presenciar a morte do filho.


Bayek é, sem dúvidas, um dos protagonistas mais interessantes de toda a série. Isso porque o personagem é obrigado a lidar com o seu passado cruel, que o transforma em um assassino impiedoso, atormentado e com sede de vingança. A história profunda e suas motivações estreitam de maneira singular a relação entre jogador e personagem.


Para explorar o deserto, Bayek conta com a ajuda de um camelo - que posteriormente pode ser substituído por um cavalo no estábulo - e sua águia Senu. Ao acioná-la, ele ganha uma visão panorâmica da área e, a partir disso, consegue mapear o território inimigo por completo, além de pontos de interesse relevantes, como itens escondidos, atalhos, tumbas e missões extras. 


A presença da ave é uma das maiores adições do jogo, o que garante uma dinâmica diferente, mais voltada à estratégia. O sistema de combate também foi completamente redesenhado para dar novo compasso às lutas. Em vez de apostar em animações temporizadas, a movimentação de Bayek é a mistura perfeita entre The Witcher e Dark Souls, com golpes que demandam posicionamento inteligente.


O ritmo do combate é como uma dança cadenciada em que esquiva e defesa são passos essenciais. Apesar de funcionar bem, o novo sistema de batalha requer adaptação e treino - muito treino -, especialmente para fãs mais antigos que estão adaptados à luta leve e acelerada dos títulos anteriores.


Embora seja um jogo de ação, Origins traz um sistema de loot herdado de RPGs atuais, algo semelhante ao que se vê em Destiny e The Division. Em vez de comprar equipamentos, Bayek passa a adquiri-los em missões e atividades pelo mundo. Armas e vestimentas têm níveis de raridade e poder, portanto é necessário trocá-las o tempo todo por opções melhores.


Há, também, um sistema robusto de progressão que oferece dezenas de habilidades desbloqueáveis ao herói. É claro que isso não é uma grande novidade na série, mas o nível de profundidade dos atributos é admirável, o que possibilita novas formas de jogar e agir diante dos inimigos.

O arco, por exemplo, que passou a ser um item indispensável, ganhou atenção especial e traz habilidades novas por meio da árvore de skills. Bayek deve caçar animais com o seu arco e flecha para obter matéria-prima no melhor estilo Far Cry. Você pode usar o material coletado para confeccionar bolsas maiores e acessórios que aumentam a defesa e ampliam a taxa de dano.


Além disso, Bayek é capaz de explorar e escalar pirâmides, desertos, tumbas escondidas e oásis em cinco regiões colossais. Origins brinda os jogadores com o maior mapa já visto na série - e um dos maiores em games do gênero. Os cenários de Nilo, Cirenaica, Siuá, Guiza e Faium chegam a assustar por terem dimensões positivamente exageradas.


Assassin's Creed Origins comprova que o tempo de produção prolongado só fez bem ao seu visual. O jogo dá um salto gráfico impressionante em comparação a Syndicate e o cuidado com os detalhes dos cenários é de deixar qualquer um maravilhado. Os trabalhos de iluminação e clima dinâmico também estão impecáveis, proporcionando cenas incrivelmente realistas.




Normalmente muitos classificam o habito de jogar como forma de lazer mas eu aprendi a ver esses jogos como forma de apreciar uma obra de arte. Eu sempre tive o sonho de criar uma obra de ficção e adapta-la  para os jogos uma grande o suficiente para se tornar uma trilogia e hoje mesmo comecei a assistir o filme "com amor Van Gogh" e percebi que essa historia se repete varias vezes no mundo dos jogos. Van Gogh foi um dos melhores artistas que já viveu mas não viveu o suficiente para ser reconhecido sabendo desse fato percebi que a franquia Assasins Creed e varias outras além dessa tiveram mentes brilhantes por trás mas em nenhum momento foram reconhecidas como deveriam. Em vários momentos vejo que o passado volta a acontecer sem sequer nos percebemos ai eu fiquei pensando e se eu acabar como Van Gogh acabou taxado de maluco, uma incógnita na sociedade  mas com essa mente capaz de criar um quadro de espirrais em um céu estrelado perfeito. E agora eu vejo que assasin s creed é uma franquia que demorou para evoluir assim como Vincent Van Gogh mas a partir desse jogo esses desenvolvedores foram responsáveis por criar esse incrível deserto que tem consigo vegetação e ambiente único que serve pra mim como estar diante da espiral de Van Gogh. todos os que vieram assasins creed partir deste são como "A noite estrelada".



Quando joguei Assassin’s Creed Origins e fiquei simplesmente encantado. O mundo aberto, os gráficos, a história do jogo e o personagem principal...é tudo perfeito, o protagonista (Bayek) é um dos melhores, na minha opinião, com sua honestidade, senso de justiça e dever, ele é carismático, solidário e vingativo. O mundo do Antigo Egito também não decepcionou em nada, um trabalho impecável e uma ambientação incrível, eu sou particularmente fã de história, então achei demais jogar esse jogo e aprender sobre o Egito ao mesmo tempo. Assassin’s Creed Origins marca o início de uma nova era de jogabilidade, trazendo oportunidades de combate extremamente satisfatórias e a exploração de um mapa vasto de paisagens e conhecimentos.


Pode comprar sem Medo é maravilhoso mesmo.


Prós

* Combate redesenhado
* Traz o melhor assassino da série
* Cenários gigantescos
* Recheado de atividades
* História
* Divertido ao extremo


Contras

* Certas áreas vazias no mapa
* Alguns Bugs

[No Spoilers] This is a good open world Action RPG with Assassins Creed Elements in the story an the gameplay which caters to free to play audiences and lacks an identity.

Pros: 
1. Well crafted and good looking world by land, air, sea and underwater. Much better than the one in Valhalla, a bit better than Horizon Zero Dawn 1 and 2.
2. Graphics is a few times better on PC which initially put me off to play it on PS5 when it was free for a month. On max settings it is still a very playable game.
3. A good part of the story is related to AC universe unlike in Valhalla.
4. Main characters are better developed through the game unlike in Valhalla where the main characters feel like NPCs.

Cons: 
1. Too much grind. Even some main story missions are fetch and grind ones, also forced combat missions from time to time.
2. The world is not made good use of in terms of main and side quests, the gameplay and story potential of it is wasted beyond visual joy.
3. As an open world Action RPG the game directly competes with the likes of the Witcher 3, regardless if the publisher likes it or not. And as such it fails miserably to implement any sort of short or long, or perceived decisions or impact of choices, in fact the whole experience is "on rails".
4. Parkour mechanics and stealth gameplay, also tools, are removed, reduced or dumbed down.
5. The game will automatically put side quests into the journal, without the player searching or accepting them. One quest is even formulated as a phishing attack threatening the destruction of the first village, but actually having no consequences.
6. The story is AC related but is watered down with more than a few fetch and return quests, from a point forward it follows the formula of Valhalla with the copy-paste forts progression, with the only benefit here is the forts do not need to be taken and stealth remains very viable in almost all cases.
7. The story is interesting but overall has too much filler in the middle, unlike in Unity which is actually 5-10% shorter but much more thrilling and assassin like. Origins feels more like cow milking the brand.
8. There are no co-op missions like in Unity which were and still are (last I Played in Jan 25 matchmaking was taking only a minute)
9. AC Black Flag's naval combat is still superior to both Origins and Valhalla, and even though servers are down is played by around 100 000 players daily. Origins' naval combat feels really clunky, the ramming animation feels like a magnet. Ship sailing and how it moves in the water is actually less realistic than in Black Flag.
10. Completely broken character progression, item crafting and skill trees systems. To advance a level hundreds of soldiers need to be killed/assassinated. Alternatively fetch and clear bandit camp quests are available. Huger and huger gaps of the level requirements between the main missions. From 2-3 side missions per main mission to be able to defeat the next to 5 or more between each main mission. A huge grind. 
10.1. Even on easy which I played, when there are more than a few levels of difference it becomes impossible to assassinate or fight enemy soldiers, which means the grind is made mandatory.
10.2. Hundreds of pointless item upgrades no one will use. Totally broken system where spending hours to get a legendary item gets replaced in 5 seconds by killing a random soldier of the player's level who drops a regular item but of a higher level which is 20-30% more powerful than the legendary item.
10.3. Most skills are completely useless in and outside combat, many are also expensive requiring multiple level ups to unlock a single point. Gear drops and upgrades dictate how strong the character is.
11. The game lacks identity and the AC brand still fits but a lot of potential is wasted especially with the game systems and the open world.
12. Some of the good AC main line lore content is outsourced to side quests which without a guide would be difficult to discover between the fetch and collect quests.

185590289.review:
El trabajo bien hecho se nota.
Este es un juego que no se parece en casi nada a la saga Assassin's, por eso me lo compré. Yo quería una aventura estilo Skyrim en el Antiguo Egipto. La saga Assassin's nunca me llamó la atención y no me he equivocado. Todo en el juego es tan grande e inabarcable que creo que es mejor hacer la reseña como me gusta:
Lo que más me ha gustado:
-Ambientación y exploración del Antiguo Egipto, sus templos y tumbas, su historia y su mezcla con la civilización helenística.
-La personalización, las monturas y el árbol de habilidades. Me recuerda mucho a mi querido Skyrim.
-El desierto, los susurros en la arena cuando te quedas solo caminando por él.
-El DLC de la maldición de los faraones: la representación de Ajetatón, la Duat, el paraíso de los egipcios, el limbo de Ramsés II...un DLC fantástico con una ambientación de ensueño.
-El respeto por la mitología egipcia y su historia.
-Alejandría. Toda ella.
Lo que no me ha gustado:
-La historia de los protagonistas. Enésima historia de venganza e intriga política con Cleopatra de por medio.
-Todo lo que tiene que ver con el Animus y los Asesinos. No me gusta nada la historia del juego ni sus anteriores entregas. Las partes en las que se sale del Animus yo volvía a entrar lo más deprisa posible para seguir en Egipto.
-Muchas misiones secundarias son puro relleno para alargar el juego. Esta parte no sabía si ponerla en aspectos negativos. Los que estamos acostumbrados al rol tenemos por norma explorar todas las mazmorras y farmear para obtener equipo y experiencia, pero entiendo que a mucha gente se le haga tedioso rescatar mercaderes o asaltar campamentos para saquear un cofre.
-El DLC del Sinaí. Totalmente olivdable y aburrido. Sólo parcialmente salvable por la ciudad de Arsínoe.
-Muchos personajes son olvidables y no quedarán para la historia. Aquí no hay un Ulfric o un Maiq el mentiroso, o una Serana. Se nota que me quedé mentalmente en 2012. Lástima no poder volver atrás en el tiempo y vivir de nuevo lo que fue Skyrim.
En definitiva, muy recomendable para los casuals a los que no nos interesa la Saga, porque no se le parece en casi nada y apenas hay conexión real con el tema Asesinos. Yo quería un juego de exploración de tumbas y rol como el viejo Diablo 2 pero en Egipto. No le pido más y me voy muy satisfecho.

185587560.developer_response:
Hey there Carrots The Turkey, I'm sorry to hear about the troubles you've had when trying to play Assassin's Creed Origins, following latest Windows 11 update. This issue was [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/582160/discussions/0/4630358592048884249/]reported[/url] for investigation and a new title update has been deployed to resolve these compatibility issues with the Windows 11 update 24H2. 

If you're still experiencing these issues after the update, I'd like to provide some troubleshooting to help limit how often these issues occur:

- Ensure Assassin's Creed Origins is installed on the same drive as both Steam and Ubisoft Connect
- [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/help?article=000060529]Verify[/url] the game files
- [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/help?article=000063761]Clean boot[/url] to rule out background processes that could be conflicting (Overwolf, Steel Series, Corsair, iCue3, Razer, Synapse, etc.)
- Make sure that Ubisoft Connect PC is not being [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/preventing-software-conflicts-with-ubisoft-games/000061015]blocked[/url] by any security software you have, such as a firewall or anti-virus. 
- Clear the cache in [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/6AD7-820D-8BE5-E51F#:~:text=From%20your%20Steam%20Client%2C%20open,Cache%22%20button%20at%20the%20bottom.]Steam[/url]
- Clear the cache in [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/emptying-the-cache-of-ubisoft-connect-pc/000061966]Ubisoft Connect[/url]
- Run [url=https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/use-the-system-file-checker-tool-to-repair-missing-or-corrupted-system-files-79aa86cb-ca52-166a-92a3-966e85d4094e]Microsoft's System File Checker tool[/url]to repair any missing or corrupted files
- Reinstall the [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/help?article=000062655]supporting software[/url] for the game
- [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/help?article=000064837]Update Graphics Drivers[/url]
- Complete [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/Article/000061047]our guide[/url] here

If your game is still freezing after you've completed the suggested instructions, I encourage you to create a ticket on our [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/company/contact-us]Help website[/url] and include your [url= https://www.ubisoft.com/help?article=000061449]system files[/url] in the attachments. Make sure to fully explain the issue and specify exactly what troubleshooting steps you have tried so far to reduce the chance for repeated steps. Our support team will receive everything and then contact you to proceed. Thank you!

185571736.review:
支线任务公式化严重，前几个小时体验感还算是比较新鲜倒觉得没什么毛病，玩到后面发现基本上无非就是救人杀人清据点，属实让人觉得有点审美疲劳。
不过这一点本身硬要说的话其实也不算啥大问题，问题是这游戏就硬要逼着你刷支线，完成主线任务给的经验很少，等级压制严重，敌人等级比你高个三四级就是红名，你打人家就像在刮痧，人家砍你一两刀你基本就非死即残了，刺杀也只能掉一点点血，逼着你不得不去大量做支线清地图上的感叹号，玩的实在是难受，之前18年就因为这个弃坑过一次了，现在开了个新档重新玩还是一样的体验，虽然一路看下来基本都是好评，但我在这里还是想给个差评。
不过其他方面的话都还算过关，游戏整体的氛围不错，美术和建模都能算优秀，在历史考据这方面的一些细节都做到了还原，史低可以考虑入一个当风景模拟器玩玩（育碧传统艺能)

185558189.review:
Assassin´s Creed Origins. (REVIEW INCLUDES SPOILERS!)

I have now played through the main story twice and DLCs once. All in all AC Origins is a great game and good origin story to beginning of Hidden Ones.
World of Egypt is beautiful and you can see that at the time the developers put effort to creating the world and quests. Discovery Tour is amazing addition (Ubisoft more like this!) if you are interested of going through some Egypt's history. 
Story is interesting in main story and Hidden Ones, but in Curse of Pharaohs it felt like the whole story didn't get good closure.
Ofcourse AC Origins also includes annoying bugs, invisible walls, glitches and the detection system is so broken sometimes I am sure that enemies smell Bayeks sweat or something....
All in all still a good game experience for AC fans new or old. This is also a good one to start from (unless u wanna do Odyssey first...)

185543294.review:
«сотні аванпостів і тисячі знаків питання...»
Assassin's Creed® Origins виявилася дуже гарною, дизайн і розробка світу дивує, але його наповнення - це відстій. сотні абсолютно однакових аванпостів і тисячі абсолютно однакових знаків питання. Навіть як любитель досліджувати всю карту за 50 годин чесно кажучи втомився конкретно. Сюжет гри хоч примітивний але піде. Усі додаткові завдання це «принеси подай, іди наhyй не мішай». Кароче нескінченний грінд грінд грінд і грінд. Досі залишаю собі за мету зачистити карту на 100% і виконати всі додаткові квести, але це може зайняти ще годин 50, тож поки що залишаю це на майбутнє... Загалом гра на 6/10. Дуже гарно, приємна бойовка, сюжет - піде, але наповнення світу і різноманітність доп завдань хромає.

+ Очень крутой и проработанный главный герой, тупо гигачад из древнего египта
+ Атмосферный и приятный саундтрек
+ Культура и мифология древнего египта поданы на 10/10
+ Действительно неплохой сюжет
+ Множество интересных локаций на карте
+ Довольно много интересных сайд квестов 
+ Есть неплохие босс файты, возможность стать гладиатором в колизее
+ Все еще очень красивая картинка, хоть и видно, что игра далеко не новая
+ Хорошие DLC, которые бы я оценил на 7/10 (Незримые) и 10/10 (Проклятие Фараонов)
+ Отдельно стоит упомянуть интерактивный тур (перед игрой или в перерывах рекомендую пройти раздел "повседневная жизнь")
+ Свежий патч починил игру на win11, всё работает

До 10/10 игре не хватило:
- Боёвка в игре просто есть, назвать её какой то хорошей при всём желании нельзя 
- Есть прокачка и навыки, но они просто есть и мало на что влияют
- Сюжетные и сайд квесты круто обыграны, но геймлейного разнообразия мало, хотя если бы не 2 проблемы выше, то кто знает

Все эти нюансы исправили в одиссее, а достоинства лишь приумножили, но тут уж как есть

В целом самый главный козырь этой игры —  потрясающая атмосфера из за которой многое можно простить или даже не заметить, ведь главное получать удовольствие от процесса и с этим Истоки справляются 

Игру прошел на 100% ачивок и каких то слишком душных среди них вовсе нету, думаю выбить будет под силу каждому, если вы любитель подобного

Под самый конец игра предложит крутое DLC "Проклятие Фараонов", которое прям очень приятно удивит и станет достойным финалом в вашем путешествии по древнему египту

8/10

185517609.review:
Playing this one a bit late and having played only the very first Assassin's Creed as a kid on the original Xbox. 

The world here is absolutely GORGEOUS and overall beautifully crafted. 

However, at it's core it is a boring game plagued with bad philosophy of what make a game engaging and interesting. Any RPG element in this game is beyond simplified and meaningless. All gear has more or less 1 stat dependent on the level of the item. Absolutely no variance. The skill tree as you level up is meaningless as well. Outside of a few skill points in the beginning of the game the skill points bring very little in terms of altering your experience as you play the game. 

The difficulty is very low besides on the highest difficulty and even then it didn't seem like a satisfying challenge to me. It is just "ok". 

The interface is so overwhelming with flashing lights and bells and whistles all over the screen of where to go, what to get, where the next step is. In a huge world like this you should let the player decide and let them get immersed in it and not put cheap text on top of everything they do. The options in the game for changing this are absolute garbage. I used a 3rd party mod which took me hours to customize to the way I like but of course not everything works perfectly because it is a 3rd party mod. 

Level scaling is just off. As soon as the monsters are a few levels above you you have no chance completely artificaly. Not because of poor stats or some meaningful decision, just because the developers have made your damage absolutely useless based on monsters being more than 3-4 levels higher than you. This really limits your options on where to go. On the flip side, low level content starts becoming worthless as you progress. You can turn on level scaling which is also bad design in my opinion. 

The story is probably somewhere between average and slightly above average. Actually not bad but what good is a decent story in a game which fails to motive you to play it. 

The world events and side quests start getting very repetitive pretty soon and offer little in terms of WHY you should be doing them. 
The game is kinda old now but it really fails to hit the spot for me. I wish they put better design of the actual game play and more meaning behind the RPG elements inside the amazing world they created. Hek.. you can climb the actual Pyramids and the great Alexandria Lighthouse. You can go IN the great Alexandria library. 

5.5/10 but would not recommend

185517233.review: The story is a huge step up from Unity and Syndicate but unfortunately it falls apart in the last act which feels extremely rushed. The beginning and the middle parts though, where you hunt down targets from a list, is very enjoyable. The villains were interesting enough to keep me hooked with the gameplay loop. However, the biggest flaw of this game is its very size. Even though it's gorgeous and intricately detailed, at one point it becomes really tedious to get through the regions. They tried to copy the Witcher 3 approach of exploration and side quests between the main quest, but it only works when the writing is like Witcher 3. Side quests in this game are a mixed bag - the ones which are good are really really good while the bad ones are literally mood killers. Parkour has been simplified way too much and it's frankly not good. Even the stylish assassination techniques from the previous games have been removed. The rpg mechanics like level gating and rarity tiers for gear is another tedious addition. The game has a lot of flaws, but the overall package somehow works out to be fun enough that I don't mind recommending it. The DLCs are forgettable though, the campaigns were barely interesting unlike the base game; I just finished them to see the new cities and sights, some of which are magnificent especially 4 special areas in the curse DLC.

185491380.developer_response:
Hey there, I apologize for the frequent crashes you've experienced when trying to play Assassin's Creed Origins. If you are using the Windows 11 24h2 build, I can confirm that crashing problem has already been reported for [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/582160/discussions/0/4630358592048884249/]investigation[/url] and our teams are already working with [url=https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/release-health/status-windows-11-24h2#3448msgdesc]Microsoft[/url] to figure out a resolution.

If you're not using Windows 11 24h2 build, I'd like to provide some troubleshooting to help limit how often these crashes occur:

- Ensure Assassin's Creed Origins is installed on the same drive as both Steam and Ubisoft Connect
- [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/help?article=000060529]Verify[/url] the game files
- [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/help?article=000063761]Clean boot[/url] to rule out background processes that could be conflicting (Overwolf, Steel Series, Corsair, iCue3, Razer, Synapse, etc.)
- Make sure you have the latest version of Ubisoft Connect PC installed (Please note that Ubisoft Connect PC will launch in Offline mode if you have no internet connection. In Offline mode, the updates will not be installed automatically)
- Make sure that Ubisoft Connect PC is not being [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/preventing-software-conflicts-with-ubisoft-games/000061015]blocked[/url] by any security software you have, such as a firewall or anti-virus. 
- Clear the cache in [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/6AD7-820D-8BE5-E51F#:~:text=From%20your%20Steam%20Client%2C%20open,Cache%22%20button%20at%20the%20bottom.]Steam[/url]
- Clear the cache in [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/emptying-the-cache-of-ubisoft-connect-pc/000061966]Ubisoft Connect[/url]
- Run [url=https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/use-the-system-file-checker-tool-to-repair-missing-or-corrupted-system-files-79aa86cb-ca52-166a-92a3-966e85d4094e]Microsoft's System File Checker tool[/url]to repair any missing or corrupted files
- Reinstall the [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/help?article=000062655]supporting software[/url] for the game
- [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/help?article=000064837]Update Graphics Drivers[/url]
- Complete [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/Article/000061047]our guide[/url] here

If you're still having troubles playing your game after you've tried the suggested instructions, I encourage you to create a ticket on our [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/company/contact-us]Help website[/url] and include your [url= https://www.ubisoft.com/help?article=000061449]system files[/url] in the attachments. Make sure to fully explain the issue and specify exactly what troubleshooting steps you have tried so far to reduce the chance for repeated steps. Our support team will receive everything and then contact you to proceed. Thank you!

185476081.review: THE BEST GAME I'VE EVER PLAYED

185475959.review:
After playing AC Origins a few years ago, I re bought the game on PC recently during the sale and finally decided to 100% it, and it was worth it.

𝐁𝐚𝐬𝐞 𝐠𝐚𝐦𝐞
The base game of Origins is one of my favourite in the AC collection, while yes the trope of "this person close to me died and now I want revenge" is the premise of the game, it's much more. The side content is abundant (maybe more than it should Ubisoft) and the combat is...ok for the most part, I'm not really a fan of the RPGCreed combat but it does its job in giving a challenge and the occasional fun moments. Such as the war Elephant's, so good job there Ubi. And the length of the story is perfect for the price (8/10)

𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐇𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐎𝐧𝐞𝐬
The start of the Assassin's Creed (pun intended) that takes place 4 years after the main story, it is a short-ish but awesome experience and generally my favourite part of this game, it gives you a lot of lore about the order of assassin's and how it was founded, and also continues from the ending. The map of this DLC is small but there's quite a lot of side content in it and also some new weapons that you can find. And also a brand new outfit which is honestly the best looking one in the game, It's the "Hidden One" outfit and resembles Ezio's outfit (kinda) but I wore it for the rest of the DLC and the next one, speaking of. (10/10)

𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐂𝐮𝐫𝐬𝐞 𝐎𝐟 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐏𝐡𝐚𝐫𝐚𝐨𝐡𝐬
The 2nd and last DLC of Origins and a great one as well, also takes place 4 years after the main story. This DLC is rather long alongside this, the map/side content is abundant as well, the map is split up into about 5 regions and are nice to look at. Along with the new map your max level gets raised to 55 but you can still earn ability points after you max out. The story itself it's very good, focusing on the pharaohs (obviously) and also the afterlife which takes the form of 4 tombs each with their own "world", my favourite being the Duat. The bosses in this DLC are phenomenal and the boss arenas themselves are aesthetically pleasing to look at. The weapons you obtain also look cool, and are probably cool to use (wouldn't know I never used them lol) overall if you liked AC Origins give the DLC's a try! (8/10)

185445626.review:
Assassin's Creed Origins is a bold reimagining of the franchise that reinvents many elements of the series while staying true to its roots. Developed by Ubisoft, it was released in 2017, and marks the beginning of a new saga in the Assassin's Creed timeline, set in ancient Egypt during the Ptolemaic period.

Story and Setting
The story follows Bayek, a Medjay (an ancient Egyptian lawkeeper), whose personal vendetta against the Order of the Ancients — the precursor to the Templars — leads him on a journey that unravels the origins of the Assassins. The narrative is deeply personal and filled with emotional stakes, with Bayek’s quest for justice drawing players into the world of ancient Egypt.

The setting is a true highlight. Egypt feels alive and vast, from the deserts to the Nile river, bustling cities like Alexandria and Memphis, and mysterious tombs and pyramids. The attention to detail in recreating ancient Egyptian culture, architecture, and daily life is remarkable. It’s a world that invites exploration and rewards curiosity with hidden treasures, secrets, and historical events.

Gameplay and Combat
One of the most significant changes in Origins is the shift from the traditional Assassin’s Creed formula to an action RPG approach. This transformation includes a new leveling system, gear, and skill trees. Combat is now more dynamic and methodical, with a focus on timing, dodging, and strategically using different types of weapons. Bayek can wield a variety of weapons such as swords, shields, and bows, each with unique abilities and combos.

The game introduces a more fluid, free-form combat system that gives it a heavier focus on skill-based play, and while it can feel clunky at times, particularly in larger battles, it remains satisfying once you master the system. The bow, in particular, is a standout weapon, allowing for long-range precision shots that add depth to both combat and exploration.

The addition of RPG elements such as side quests, leveling, and skill trees gives the game a sense of progression that was missing in previous Assassin's Creed titles. This adds to the game's replayability, as there's always something to do, whether it's exploring ancient tombs, hunting wildlife, or getting involved in side activities that flesh out the world.

Exploration and World Design
The open world in Origins is vast and expansive, offering players the freedom to explore the entirety of Egypt. This game does away with the linear quest structure of earlier entries in favor of a more organic, open-world approach. The map is full of activities, from uncovering ancient secrets to engaging with NPCs for side stories and contracts. The dynamic day-night cycle and realistic weather systems further enhance the immersive experience.

However, there’s a noticeable lack of a strong narrative thread tying all of the side activities together, which may detract from the pacing for some players. Still, the world is full of charm and wonder, and the sheer scale of it is awe-inspiring.

Visuals and Sound
Origins is a beautiful game. The vast deserts, rich forests, and grand cities are all brought to life with stunning visual fidelity. The lighting is particularly noteworthy, as the game does an excellent job of capturing the heat of the Egyptian sun and the shadows of its temples. The character models, animations, and environmental details all contribute to a world that feels lived-in and authentic.

The soundtrack complements the setting perfectly, with sweeping orchestral pieces that heighten the epic nature of the adventure. Voice acting is solid, especially for Bayek and his companions, bringing emotional depth to the story.

Final Thoughts
Assassin’s Creed Origins is a standout entry in the franchise that successfully reinvents the series with its RPG mechanics, vast open world, and deeper focus on exploration. While the shift in gameplay can feel jarring for long-time fans of the series, it ultimately pays off, offering one of the most engrossing and expansive worlds in recent gaming memory.

With its stunning setting, engaging combat, and rich narrative, Assassin’s Creed Origins provides an unforgettable adventure through ancient Egypt. It’s an exciting step forward for the series and a must-play for fans of action RPGs or history enthusiasts alike.

185443385.review:
AC beleuchtet seine Ursprünge (Origins) in Ägypten und erfindet sich doch teilweise neu. Es gibt nun viele RPG-Elemente und merklich individuellere Nebenquests. Aber der Reihe nach:

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3404423176
[b]Geschichte[/b]

Die Rahmenhandlung ist weiterhin minimal und wird meist nur kurz nach jedem der vielleicht 12 Kapitel in Erinnerung gerufen. Wir spielen dort Layla, die sich in die Erinnerungen des Ehepaars Bayek und Aya begibt, die um 50 v.u.Z. zur Zeit von Kleopatra VII. ([i]der[/i] Kleopatra, die mit Julius Caesar anbandelte) im alten Ägypten gelebt haben.

Der geschichtliche Hintergrund ist also eine der bekanntesten Episoden aus der Geschichte des alten Ägyptens, aber Caesar spielt nur eine Nebenrolle, ebenso, was alles danach geschah. Statt dessen geht es hauptsächlich um einen Konflikt Kleopatras mit ihrem Bruder und Mitregent Ptolomaios XIII., über den heutzutage m.M.n. fast nichts bekannt ist. Insofern ehrlich gesagt ein wenig Enttäuschung, wenn man sich ein großes Geschichtsepos erhofft hat. Warum man die naheliegende Episode der Weltgeschichte (vgl. die Amerikanische Revolution in AC III) hier eher nur streifte? Vielleicht weil ein solcher Konflikt sich eher für ein Open-World-Spiel eignet, in dem ganz Ägypten bereist werden kann.

Wir spielen also Bayek (und manchmal seine Frau Aya), der als Medjaj (eine Art Friedensrichter) in Siwa arbeitet. Durch eine mysteriöse Gruppe von Männern verliert er seinen Sohn und so begibt er sich auf die Suche nach den Tätern. Diese Suche (eine klassische Rachestory also) führt ihn nach Alexandria und zu Kleopatra, aber auch zu allen Ecken Ägyptens.

Highlight ist auch hier eher die Umgebung, ganz besonders natürlich die Pyramiden von Gizeh. Aber auch sonst durchstreifen wir eine abwechslungsreiche Landschaft mit Dörfern und Städten am Nil und Seen, Wüsten und Oasen.

Manchmal spielen wir auch als Aya, eine starke, eigenständige Frau. Aber wir können nicht frei zwischen beiden Charakteren wählen. Kleopatra, Caesar und andere Figuren sind eher nur Deko.

Auch wenn es also nicht das von mir erhoffte Geschichtsepos ist, hat mir die Geschichte gefallen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3406107643
[b]Gameplay[/b]

Es ist immer noch deutlich ein AC und die Ubisoft-Formel wird fleißig weiter betrieben. Und doch gibt es deutliche Änderungen im Vergleich zu den Vorgängern.

So hat Origins nun viele Aspekte eines RPG. Wir haben ein Questlog, das bald, wenn wir fleißig die Marker auf der Karte auswerten, anschwillt an Haupt-, Neben- und Tagesaufgaben. Wir bekommen durch Kämpfe Beutestücke, insbesondere Waffen, die unterschiedlich stark sind und uns so einige Zeit mit Vergleichen und Aussortieren verbringen lassen kann (ich habe das weitgehend ignoriert). Zudem gibt es einen umfangreichen Fähigkeitenbaum (der einige echte Verbesserungen ermöglicht) und Levelupgrades durch Erfahrung, was wirklich wichtig ist für die Kämpfe mit schwereren Gegnern, was aber ziemlich zeitaufwendig ist.

Die Nebenquests sind alle individuell gestaltet (ein erheblicher Unterschied im Vergleich zu vorigen AC's), auch wenn sich mit der Zeit doch gewisse Schemata abzeichnen.

Die Geschichte führt uns meist zu einem der o.g. Übeltäter, den wir dann assassinenartig erledigen, was uns eine kurze Rückkehr in die Rahmenhandlung beschert.

Die vielleicht entscheidende Änderung ist aber ein verbessertes Kampfsystem, bei dem man ausweichen und blocken kann, leichter, schwerer oder superschwerer Angriff möglich ist und das mit unterschiedlichen Waffen (Dolch, Schwert, Lanze oder Keule), die deutlich  unterschiedlich austeilen. Zudem haben wir Bögen verschiedener Bauart, Bomben und Schlafpfeile zur Verfügung.

Es gibt diesmal sogar zwei Arten der Hellsicht, eine ganz banale, nicht weiter begründete, und eine mit Hilfe eines Vogels. Das ist praktisch, macht es ggf. aber schon ziemlich einfach. Man kann andererseits ja auch den Schwierigkeitsgrad jederzeit erhöhen.

Sehr schön (wenngleich eigentlich selbstverständlich, aber nicht bei AC) auch, dass die Örtlichkeiten, z.B. Festungen der Römer, aber auch Höhlen und Gräber, individuell gestaltet sind und so bei Kämpfen, aber auch bei Rätseln Abwechslung bieten.

Denn neben den vielen Kämpfen (man kann auch schleichend vorgehen) gibt es auch einige Rätsel. Ein Typ sind Gräber (relativ leicht). Am schönsten fand ich wieder die detektivischen Rätsel (diesmal in reiner Textform), durch die man gut versteckte Objekte finden kann. Im besten Falle wirklich cool gemacht, hat man dabei aber ein paar Ortsbezeichnungen nicht mit der Karte abgestimmt.

Insgesamt hat mich das Gameplay diesmal sehr gefesselt und es würde mir selbst jetzt noch Spaß machen, einige weitere Aufgaben zu erledigen. Die ganzen noch drum herum verfügbaren Spielmöglichkeiten habe ich dabei gar nicht angefasst (keine Ahnung ob die noch "aktiv" sind). Dass man viele Objekte nur durch Helix-Credits erwerben kann (und das letztlich überwiegend mit Echtgeld) zeigt, dass AC auch solche Trends mitgeht.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3406103108
[b]Technik[/b]

Technisch sehr gut. Mir ist das Spiel nur einmal abgestürzt und es hat auch nur einmal nach vielen Stunden Spielzeit zu ruckeln angefangen.

Grafisch sehr schön. Die meist lichtdurchflutete Landschaft ist herrlich und man kann die Tempel in ihrer vermuteten farblichen Schönheit bewunden. OK, gerade die Tempel ähneln sich ziemlich arg und nicht alle Sehenswürdigkeiten Ägyptens wurden digital umgesetzt, aber es gibt schon viel zu sehen und zu entdecken.

Der Sound ist gut. Musik ist mir nicht aufgefallen. Also vorwiegend die Geräuschkulisse. Die Stimmen der Hauptakteure waren OK.

Die Steuerung ist gut. Ich habe mit Controller gespielt, selbst bei den Kämpfen, und das hat wunderbar geklappt. Nur die Auswahl der Waffe ist suboptimal. Mit der Tastatur sollte es natürlich ebenso gehen.

[b]Sonstiges[/b]

Ich habe etwa 90h im Spiel verbracht. Schwer zu sagen, wie viel davon für die Hauptmission erforderlich war.

Es gibt ja mittlerweile Errungenschaften und davon sind einige ziemlich aufwendig. Zudem haben auch die DLC's "Der Fluch der Pharaonen" und "Die Verborgenen" Errungenschaften (machen etwa 25% aus). Die DLC's waren in dem Bundle nicht dabei und sind nicht ganz billig.

[code][b]In Zahlen für mich persönlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 10/10.[/b][/code]

Ein RPG-lastigeres AC. Erfrischend anders und unterhaltsam, aber immer noch AC.

[hr][/hr]
[i]Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. Für meine Wertung zählt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abhängig davon, ob ich es einem ähnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.[/i]

185437365.review: Prawdopodobnie ostatnia bardo dobra gra od ubi. Pierwsza odsłona z mechanikami RPG, które w praktyce sprawdzają się na prawde wporządku i zbieranie wszystkich surowców przychodzi naturalnie. Bayek jest zajebiście napisanym bohaterem który może stanąć ramie w ramie obok Ezia albo Edwarda, jest bohaterem którego łatwo polubić i to wrażenie nie znika przez całą gre. Większymi minusami może być to że wiele misji jest zablokowanych za poziomem i trzeba przeznaczyć sporo czasu na robienie misji pobocznych, które są bardzo mieszane niektóre są świetne, a niektóre to zapychacze pokroju przynieś, zabij, pozamiataj. 185436907.developer_response:
Hey there Ultimate Ruler! Our teams did recently resolve a [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/582160/discussions/0/4630358592048884249/]similar issue[/url] to what you've described. If you did in fact have the Windows 11 24H2 update, please be sure to update the game and confirm that you have no other updates to install for Windows 11.

Once that's been done, if you are still having difficulties with Assassin's Creed Origins, please complete these steps next to cover all of our bases:

- Installing Assassin's Creed Origins on the same SSD as both Steam and Ubisoft Connect is the ideal configuration
- [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/0C48-FCBD-DA71-93EB]Verify the game files[/url]
- [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/disabling-background-applications-on-pc/000063761]Clean boot[/url] will rule out any background processes that could be conflicting (Overwolf, Steel Series, Corsair, iCue3, Razer, Synapse, etc.)
- Unplug non-essential peripherals (steering wheels and pedals, streaming equipment, additional monitors, VR equipment, etc.)
- Clear the [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/6ad7-820d-8be5-e51f]Steam cache[/url] and [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/emptying-the-cache-of-ubisoft-connect-pc/000061966]Ubisoft Connect cache[/url]
- [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/troubleshooting-technical-issues-on-pc/000061047]All steps listed in the FAQ article[/url]
- [url=https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/use-the-system-file-checker-tool-to-repair-missing-or-corrupted-system-files-79aa86cb-ca52-166a-92a3-966e85d4094e]Perform a SFC Scan[/url] (if errors are detected, repeat the scan until all results are clear)
- [url=https://docs.microsoft.com/en-US/cpp/windows/latest-supported-vc-redist?view=msvc-170]Clean reinstall the C++ supporting software[/url]

After you've gotten through the listed steps, if this freezing problem continues to happen, please [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/contact]create a new support case[/url]on the Ubi website. Attaching your [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/generating-system-reports-to-help-troubleshooting/000061449]Msinfo and Dxdiag files[/url]to your support case in advance and listing the steps/workarounds we've already tried will save a considerable amount of time. Once a member of our support team has received your case, they will review everything and then follow up with you directly to proceed further.
